result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dustin L. Cote was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Dustin L. Cote was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay fine/cost and DNA Surcharge. 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision. (Bond applied).

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
DOT Assessment.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Provide DNA sample.
Engage and comply in any counseling recommended by the Agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

supervisions.notes: Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation

ADDRESS INFO for Dustin L. Cote
Current: 2733 Clark St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-13-2018)
Prior: 1500 Strongs Avenue, c/o Portage County Jail, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Exhibit #P1 Report from Kevin Peters - Treatment Court Coordinator

Defendant Dustin L. Cote in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden. Defendant, Dustin L Cote, is in custody.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing is for the termination from treatment drug court.

1:38 p.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.

Defendant had been advised on June 5, 2018 that he would be terminated from treatment drug court and that he had the opportunity to have a hearing with regards to this.
Court questions Atty Boden; Atty Boden responds.
Court indicates that there was a report completed by K Peters - case manager for treatment drug court.
Atty Boden has received the report(s).
All parties are ready to proceed.
1:41 p.m. Officer Robert Roser is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Wetzsteon.
1:43 p.m.  Record reflects that the witness has identified the defendant.
1:49 p.m.  Atty Boden has no cross examination.
Witness is excused from his subpoena.
K.P. is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Wetzsteon.
2:02 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Boden.
2:05 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Wetzsteon.
2:08 p.m.  Re-cross by Atty Boden.
2:09 p.m.  Court requests clarification from the last response of the witness; witness responds.
Court further questions the witness.
2:10 p.m.  Atty Boden has a follow up question.
2:11 p.m.  Witness is excused.
State has no further witnesses.
2:12 p.m.  Exhibit #1, Report from the Adult Treatment Court Coordinator, is marked for the State.
Atty Wetzsteon would ask that exhibit #1 be moved into evidence.  Received by the Court and made a part of the Court record.
Defendant is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Boden.
2:15 p.m.  Atty Wetzsteon interrupts and would ask that the Court inform the defendant of self-incrimination.
Court informs the defendant that he does have the fifth amendment right to not self-incriminate and states this to the defendant on the record.
2:22 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Wetzsteon.
2:36 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Boden.
2:37 p.m.  Court questions the defendant.
2:38 p.m.  Witness is excused.
Neither party has additional witnesses.
Court questions Ms Rozak with regards to the defendant being placed in an ATR; Ms Rozak responds.
2:39 p.m.  Atty Wetzsteon gives his final argument.
2:41 p.m.  Atty Boden gives his final argument.

BY THE COURT:
If defendant successfully completes the ATR program he will not be terminated from the Treatment Drug Court.
Defendant may have to wait for an opening once he completes the ATR, as they will not "hold" a spot for him.


2:51 p.m.  Atty Wetzsteon questions wether or not the defendant can do both or has to do either the ATR or treatment drug Court.
Ms Rozak indicates that he can do both.
Court will not terminate him but allow him to successfully complete the ATR and then be reinstated into the treatment drug court.
Hearing on June 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dustin L. Cote in court with attorney D Nicholas Carroll. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the bond is denied.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 4th, OAR, Resisting/Obstructing an Officer, Bailjumping.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent and right to make a statement with regards to the facts. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Knaapen requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Works part time for cash for $30 per day to pay for his daughters day care bills.  Works for his father who owns Moreys Bar.  Asks for a high signature bond or a wage assignment.  
Court questions defendant.  Is living at his grandmothers house on Redtail Ave. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
